question: Control flow in Python determines the ________ in which statements are executed.
By default, Python executes code from ________ to bottom.
The three main types of control flow statements in Python are Conditional Statements, ________, and Jump Statements.
Conditional statements in Python are used for ________ in a program.
Which of the following is NOT a conditional statement in Python?
The if-elif-else structure allows a program to check ________ conditions.
Loops in Python help in ________ a block of code multiple times.
A for loop is mainly used to iterate over a ________ in Python.
The while loop runs until a specified ________ is met.
Jump statements in Python are used to ________ the normal loop execution.
The break statement is used to ________ a loop immediately.
The continue statement in Python skips the current iteration and moves to the ________ iteration.
The pass statement is used as a ________ when a statement is syntactically required but no action is needed.
Control flow helps a program to make ________ based on conditions.
The else block in an if-else statement executes when the if condition is ________.
